values: I had an unpleasant surprise or two today after I got home from Grandma's(Dave's) house today.  When I was making dinner I noticed a bike on my front lawn but I didn't see anyone who was riding it so I walked to my big dining room window and look around to see if I saw the kid.  I did.  Right under the window she was picking some of my spring flowers.  When she saw me she picked a couple more and took off on her bike.  I didn't care so much about those since they were annuals that somehow made it through winter.  Later however she returned with her two siblings.  I didn't notice, but I'm glad Dave did while he was doing the dishes.  He saw three heads from the kitchen window and when he went to investigate he saw the kids picking my grandmother's tulips.  He let me know and I was out of the house like a shot.  I wanted to yell and scream, but I calmly asked them to not pick my flowers.  For crying out loud those flowers aren't even near the front of the house.  you have to walk all the way to the back by the porch to get them.  What is it with kids these days?  Is it a what's mine is yours philosophy?  I have a special attachment to those tulips.  My grandmother planted those flowers years and years ago like maybe sometime in the 1980's or earlier and for years they just grew as leaves and then last year they started blooming again.  It sort of gives me the feeling of being welcomed home again and then those kids went and picked them!

I absolutely love Netflix!!!!  I have watched so many animes.  I love being able to get my fix.  One of my favorites that I want to buy for myself is Kyo Kara Maoh God Save our King!  I loved watching it and would enjoy it again and again.  It's funny but has a serious side to it as well.  Love the plot to it with the poor guy having to get sucked in through water.  I liked Black Cat as well.  His outfit is kind of weird when he breaks away from his organization and that briefcase!  It's like Mary Poppins carpet bag or a bag of holding from D&D.  I've also been keeping up with the Bleach anime.  I am so addicted to that anime and I have made my friend Colleen an addict as well.  I still love to watch it, but I have noticed that some of the fights are getting stretched out.  Not to the degree of Dragonball but at times I would say it's getting close.  Some of the fillers are really dumb like the recent Karakura town power ranger like characters.  Another one I finished watching and liked was Full Moon wo Sagashite.  That one made me cry towards the end.  Dave called me a dork when he saw me.  It was a good anime, but the ending was really sad.  When you get attached to characters you don't want to see them die or pass away.  The only down side is that only one season of the two season show made it to the US.  My friend Jason got me hooked on Naruto and I wish I had the money to buy the box sets.  That's another keeper for my collection along with its collection of movies.  I've started watching Saint Seiya and I'm 4 discs into it but I can't get the rest from Netflix so I will have to find alternative ways to finish watching it.  I think the US only got the first 32 episodes but I think that there is actually 114 episodes in the anime.  That'll take me awhile to finish watching!

Had a good time on May 3rd. Terra Jeep Club joined in on the parade in Batavia. The Loyalty Day Parade honors all of our military folks past, present, and future. The cool thing is that we placed third in the adult division of the parade. Cool! There was a hold up in the middle of the parade when one of the fire departments vehicles had to leave on a call. We didn't know anything about it until after the parade. We were back in the 4th section of the parade since we had 28 jeeps in the parade. Wow! That was a cool thing to see. I have pictures of the whole day that I will show at the end along with the clubs website. The only thing that wasn't fun at the parade was the Fox Valley Corvette Club. Don't get me wrong I like corvettes. What I don't like are corvette owners who drive their vehicles and have to sneer at our jeep club as they drive past. That's a rude thing to do, but that would be why the corvette club is our nemesis on parade day (they didn't even place in the adult division!!!). All the jeeps were decorated and my friend Colleen came out to help decorate my jeep, fondly known as Jade. I don't think we stopped laughing until it was time to line up at the parade site. I hope the pictures load. You can check out Terra at www.OIIIIIIIO.com or at www.TerraJeepClub.com . Let's hope this works. Crossing fingers....

All Hail Spring!!!  I love this time of year.  Watching all the trees become green again, the beautiful blossoms on the fruit trees, and the great taste of asparagus!  Its also the time to start hanging outside walking and biking.  Of course, spring is also when those pesky outdoor chores begin again, but we won't dwell on that!  I used to not like spring because of allergies that I would have but that has changed since I finally, finally, finally started getting my allergy shots and taking medication for it.  An even bigger plus is that by taking control of my allergy issues my asthma is way under control as well.  Score!  Now I actually can get to enjoy outside instead of being a timid little person wondering when the next attack was coming. I'm so excited that I can enjoy the seasons now.

Mother's Day was a lot of fun.  I took Mom to the Morton Arboretum for a Mother's Day Brunch at the Gingko restaurant.  We got free Champagne which I am sorry to say I  did not like at all.  Not even when they poured orange juice in to dilute the champagne.  The brunch itself was great.  There was lots of great food such as prime rib, sea bass, smoked salmon...  Did I mention the sea bass?  It was sooooo good.  Afterwards we were able to get a free hand massage and then wandered around the gift shop.  we both got some honey that was produced on site by the arboretum's bee hives.  Then we headed on over to the Thornhill Education Center to see Carpe Diem, a string quartet from Ohio Wesleyan University.  Unfortunately we were only able to stay for half the program, but we did hear was excellent.  These guys are really good.  We also found the Morton cemetery which was a plus for me since I could never find it.

brought to you by Quizilla Okay so I'm an estranged quiz collector. What can I say. I'm a Packrat. Expect a REAL update soon. I hope. Also watch for day by day journal of vacation, Christmas fun, job rants, and Big NEWS! Later All!

I was just on the phone with Dave.  Yes its one of those.  You cam shoot me later.  Anyway, we are both part of an RC race club and today he's trying to get me not to go.  So after a half hour or so of beating around the bush I tell him to tell it like it is.  He hates that he ever got me interested in rc racing.  He hates the fact that I love it.  And basically because of me he's starting to hate rc racing in general.  Apparently, rc racing was something he looked at as an a escape from meand now that I'm there he can't escape me anymore.  So I told him at the end of the season that I wouldn't rejoin and next year he can see if it begins to interest him again now that I won't be there.  After I hung up the phone I started crying.  I'm still crying.  It just seems to me that this is just one more thing that makes me feel that we aren't meant to be and I should end the whole thing which makes me cry more.  I don't what I should do.  I really love the rc club but I don't want to kill any of Dave's love for it either so I'm willing to sacrifice my love for it for him.  Is that right?  Should I sacrifice my love for it?  I don't know.  I'm so confused and hurting.  But I have to go put a happy face on and drive over to the race since we agreed to finish the season.

On another note or two or three...  I have two new additions to the family.  As most know my first set of ratties passed away.  I am now the proud owner of another pair of ratties.  One is tan with ruby eyes and I named him Kyo from the Fruits Basket anime and manga.  His brother is grey and white with ruby eyes and I named him Yuki from the same anime and manga.  It works out nice cause they like to fight and they live together.  Ok... so it made sense to me.

I was on my way to work this past saturday and I was driving behind this motorcycle.  At this one stop sign he took off from he started to pull off the side of the road to light his cigarette so I went around.  The big jerk ttok off after me once I passed him and at the light at the end of the road he pulled in front of me and started screaming at me for passing him.  When the light changed to green he stayed there yelling and when I tried to go around him he kept his bike in front of me.  I had to drive up some business' parkway to get around him and he thought I was at fault for the whole thing.  It threw me off for my day at work and we had fourteen people in for surgery.

BTW, have I mentioned how much I hate this job?

Anyway, I'm sure people have heard me say that so many times now they are probably saying shut up.  So I will.

On monday I had a good day.  Mom and I went to the museum of science and industry to see the bodyworlds exhibit.  Absolutely awesome.  If you're in Chicago go and see it before it closes on September 5.  I loved looking at the body parts they had on display and the info they gave about how they did some of it was so cool.  They even plastinated a horse for the exhibit.  I bought a postcard of that.  It may come in handy for writing.  You never know.  The spiked horse I have on top of my computer is the template for one of my equine creatures in my stories.

So thats preety much what has been going on since my last update in january.  Lets see if I can update more often now that I got five months out of the way.

You know, I feel evil.  Not the BWAHAHAHA! fun loving evil, but the one that knows they are doing wrong and do it anyway.  If that is at all understandable you'll see how I feel.  Earlier, well its yesterday now, I was talking to a friend and I was pushing her to work on things that she was weaker at.  I even made a challenge, who could draw the better perspective to help her improve her skills.  Of course I can't draw so we know who did the better drawing.^^  

Anyways I being the stupid numbskull that I am continued to push her to work on something she obviously doesn't want to have anything to do with.  I think my desire to work on it was overpowering my common sense that couldn't see past it to how she was feeling.  I feel evil for that.  I've hurt her feelings and was selfish enough to not see it when it was happening.

With all the other shit that has been going on with my life I should have realized sooner how I was pushing people.  I could have benn clinging, I could have been pushing away, I don't know anymore.  I'm sure most of you know that I am a recent graduate of college and now that I am out in the world it is increasingly hard to find a job.  I have a degree in Health education and that severly limits the job vaccancies I can fill.  

My mother, who has the best of intentions, is not helping matters in the slightest.  She's pushing me to apply to vaccancies that I am nowhere near qualified more and she gets mad at me because I have an excuse for every job she tries to force on me.  Is it wrong of me to argue about the fact that I am not qualified for that position or should I shut my mouth and apply?  Thats what confuses me.  I don't know what to do.  I've never had to do this before, but it seems to me that the advice that my mother has been giving me is wrong.

Thats not the worst of what she's doing, but I really don't feel like giving out all the gory details.  But she has been making me depressed.  I feel inadequate in everything I do these days.  It seems like nothing I do is right or it could have been done better, yet its all my fault anyway no matte what.  

The things that I love that used to make me happy aren't anymore.  I feel lifeless more and more as the days go by.  I like to sleep for as long as possible because that measn I have to be awake less.  I feel...  I don't know what I feel.  Empty mostly.  I've been crying a lot more, trying to hide away in my own house, in my dreams.  I want to be anywhere but here, and thats one desire that isn't going to change.  Knowing that makes me even more depressed to be around.

I've never been a sucidal person, or a cutter, or anything of that sort, but the stress is killing me and any solution no matter how bad is sounding good to me.  Its an escape away from the nagging, from the weight and the depression.  I need to find something to get away.  The natural high of having fun and doing what I love is gone.  There are always the chemical highs, but I won't do that so how do i get to be happy again?  Is my happy quota filled and I'm doomed to be a hollow empty husk until whenever?

I don't know.  I don't know anything anymore.  Actually, I know one thing.  I don't want to feel this way anymore and I just don't see how its going to end.

I was just looking at my last entry and all I can say is... wow!  Its what? January now?  So I figure I'd give a rundown of student teaching and everything up to this point.  Sit back and enjoy cause its going to be a long read.

First off, as most of you know, I was student teaching at St.Charles East from August 23 to October 15.  I worked with two teachers and taught five classes.  The staff was very nice to me, but the teachers I worked with weren't very good to work with.  One of my classes was a LVL 1 IEP and 504 class.  When I asked about the kids specific needs all I was told was 'don't grade them on their spelling'.  For all of you who know about IEP's and 504's thats not a good answer.  That particular cooperating teacher stayed in the classroom with two teachers that work in special ed.  It was so disconcerting working with them because they always stared at me like hawks targeting prey.  I kept screwing up because they would whisper and point at me like regular school kids.  It was hard to do good when they kept me feeling tense and extremely pressured.

My second cooperating teacher was the one who was out of school for a week at the beginning of the year.  He was always nice to me, but he hardly offered any encouragement or helpful advice.  He was usually in the classroom five minutes of maybe a few class periods and that was it.  I liked having the class to myself and I thought I had been doing well since no one was saying anything about areas I needed to improve on.  However, whenever I my supervising teacher came and they talked to her there was a whole heapful of things that I was lacking in, but they never once told me to my face so that I could improve.

Needless to say the experience was not everything I hoped it to be.  I left with a sense of that I wasn't going to be good in this profession and I was depressed at the negativity of the teachers I worked with when they spoke with my supervising teacher.  I would rather hear my faults from them so that I could improve instead of hearing them from my supervising teacher who just about accused me of not even trying to succeed at the school.  When I told her that what she was telling me was new info and that my teachers never once told me anything about what I needed to work on, she at least listened, but she expected me to right everything that I was doing poorly at in less than a week before I moved onto the second school. 

On a separate note regarding the same school, I was reacquainted with someone I knew in college.  He and I aren't friends anymore due to a bad break up with an ex.  He had to choose sides and he was living with my ex and another friend in a house.  I understood and agreed with the decision he made, but it didn't make it hurt any less.  I really liked the guy as a friend and now when I look back it could have been something more.  He is working for the school's IT department as a temp.  It was a shock to see him when I had to head up there to talk to an IT person about problems with the school email servers.  It was nice to see him again.

At the second school the atmosphere was completely different.  North High school is a richer school than East and you could see it with just about everything that it did.  The principal at east was a down to earth casual with a business flair to it.  North was straight business suits with a huge honking ring on one of his fingers.  My department head was a really nice lady that encouraged me to come visit her on off hours and talk.  She gave advice and suggestions and if I was confused on something she helped me work it out.  Coming from East that had a nice staff, but no one was really willing to help out to this stricter yet more helpful school made me feel like I was in heaven.

My cooperating teachers were very nice and they chose to stay in the classroom to observe and take notes.  After every class we sat down and talked about strengths and weaknesses and what I can do to improve.  It was such a relief to have people that actually cared and were willing to help you out.  At North I felt I was able to pull it together much better than at East with people who were actually there to help me reach for my teaching certificate.

It wasn't all sugar and sweets though.  There were problems, mostly my supervising teacher more than anyone else.  At each school there was a minimum of four classes that student teachers have to teach.  At North the only way to get four classes was for me to work with 3 teachers.  I was used to working with 2 so what was one more.  My supervising teacher was livid.  After four weeks of working with three people she wanted to pull me from North and find a middle school to work in.  I wouldn't go for it.  I told her I had been here four weeks and if I moved then I would only have two weeks to really teach.  It wouldn't be a good experience.  So then she wanted to pull me until next semester so I could have eight weeks at a middle school.  I wouldn't go for that either.  'I'm graduating in December and unless you're willing to put up my tuition for next semester we can't afford it.'

She finally conceited defeat on the pulling me out of school, but she did pull me from my third cooperating teacher so that I only worked with two people.  I later found out that my third cooperating teacher had talked to my supervising teacher and bad mouthed the entire health department at NIIU.  He had thought I was a horrible teacher and that they didn't prepare me well at all.  When I found that out I got mad, cause the man had acted like my East teachers and not said a damn thing to me about improvements.  When I asked hi how I did and if there was anything I needed to work on, it was always fine.

Once I was down to two teachers she came and observed again and this time she just about accused me of having ADD and that I needed to get checked out and properly medicated.  And here I thought she was talking about one of my students who did have ADD.  I have no idea where that came from to be honest.  The only thing I can think of is that she saw how frustrated I was getting with said ADD student and misinterpreted it.

Either way I don't have to worry anymore.  I had to teach a week longer than originally planned past my graduation, but it was good.  It was fun and I was so relieved to have made it.  I graduated December 12, 2004 and I am so happy about that.  On my last day of student teaching the staff almost made me cry.  They bought me Christmas presents and balloons.  I felt bad cause all I had was cards.  The staff at North was absolutely wonderful and I felt so sad to have to leave.  It was such a wonderful experience.

Now its January and I have been working on my resume which finally came back as a good one so now I can look for a job.  Whoopee!!!  I have also signed up to be a substitute teacher while I look for a more permanent placement.  While I'm doing that I have been keeping busy with my fanfiction and regular fiction.  You won't find my fiction anywhere at the moment, but I have posted a few fanfictions.

The first one is a oneshot called, "Who wants to live forever?" Here's the link: http://www.fanfiction.net/s/2188432/1/

The second one is a continuation of the oneshot.  It is titled "Who waits forever anyway?"  Here's the link: http://www.fanfiction.net/s/2196062/1/

I am also working on another story when inspiration gets lacking in some of my other already posted fics.  I won't be posting this one until the rest are done, but it is titled, "Protector of the Chalice".

See you later!  I'm glad you stuck around for this long entry.

Its been awhile since my last post and this is the first of probably only a few rare moments that I actually have free time.  I started student teaching at school on august 23 and scshool officially started on the 25.  Since then my free time has gone down the ol' toilet.  Up until september second I was only teaching a couple classes as I got used to being the one upfront.  

September second was a completely different story.  My cooperating teacher wasn't in and wouldn't be back until the following thursday. It wasn't a planned abscence either.   His daughter broke her arm and was hospitalized through the weekend to wednesday.  What a way to spend Labor day weekend!

That left me in a diificult position.  I was taeching all the classes suddenly and working with substitute teachers.  I couldn't ask any of them questions cause they didn't know the subject matter.  It was this past thursday that he finally came back.

And now its so disconcerting with him in the room.  I'm so used to being the only one teaching and walking around.  I find myself paying more attention to what he's doing and where he is then to my class.  Also its interesting having all overloaded classes.  A normal sized class is 24-26 students.  Mine are all 32 students each.  That really adds to the stress that I have on my shoulders right now.

The classes besides their large size is actually pretty fun.  I have some talking issues in class and I'm changing my discipline strategy for monday.  I was being a little conversation is ok to a no tolerance policy.  Its hard to get through material when the students aren't even trying to stay on task.

I don't know if this no tolerance policy is good or not, but I'm no teaching to be a friend to students.  I'm teaching so that I help enhance their lives with a subject that is very relevant to their lives whether they realize it or not.  Thats not to say that I hate teaching.  Far from it.  I'm enjoying this experience immensely.  I may be overwhelmed at times or stressing or mentally drained, but I wouldn't trade any of it for an easier life.

There have been a few people at school who are parents of teenagers themselves and they have told me that if their kids were in my school and younger(ninth graders) that they would hope that they be in my class, because they honestly think I'm doing a wonderful job of teaching the kids.  They even agree with my no tolerance policy that I'm putting into place.  And with all the stuff that has been placed on my shoulders inadvertently, they believe that I did "An absolutely beautiful and competent job of handling everything that was and is being thrown at you."

Whatc an I say to that?  I thouight I was doing horribly.  It was a nice ego boost from some of the staff at school and I'm looking forward to the rest of my weeks teaching.  that view may change, but I hope it doesn't.

I was reading July 28ths entry and thought I should update the situation.  

My jeep, Kit, was called a total loss by friday the 30th.  After much thinking it was with much sadness that we decided to not fix it.  I'll admit it.  I cried.  Well balled my friggin eyes out might be the better terminology.  So on Monday I got my things and said my last good byes to my baby.  The car was worth four grand and it was going to cost 6600 to fix.  We couldn't do that.  Not since it was in an accident prior to mine.

So up until Saturday, the seventh of August, we were car hunting and I was driving my grandfather's car.  The sonata was probably not the best choice for a vehicle since I was still a little nervous of driving and it had a slipping transmission.  That just made me all the more nervous of driving in general.

On Saturday we found a 98 jeep cheap at a local used car store.  It was under $7,000 for 75,000 miles.  After the t est drive, we bought it and the car was put into my name.  That was a shock cause weren't going to do that until I was 25 when we transfered it to me. Two years early, oh well.

So I as of this past monday I got the fluids changed.  My transmission fluid was black.  Not red tinted like it should have been.  I also found out today that I don't have a working horn.  That I need to get fixed pronto.  Its illegal to have no working horn.

All in all its not a bad vehicle.  It has its quirks, like the non working horn, the front speakers that have a bad connection, the radio that seems to enjoy AM stations much more than my FM stations.  

Completely different from Kit.  Then again no car could ever hope to be on Kit's level.  I still feel horrible that I had to give up the one thing in my life that was always there, always working.  I honestly never expected to give her up.  I know its stupid, but that jeep was much more than a vehicle in my eyes.  It was me.  She was a part of me.  Its just like losing a loved one or a pet.  You lose a piece of your soul in their passing.  

Its a period of mourning.   you buy a new dog to fill the hole that the other left behind.  I may have a newer jeep, but that hole is still there.  Still hurting.  Its going to take a long time before that hole fills up with something, be it a living breathing thing or a vehicle that somehow gets its own personality as time passes.

Now, I'm taking my steps one at a time as I move on.  Like a well loved animal or friend, I will never forget Kit and I know that one day we will meet again.  That is my fondest wish.

I don't know if I told anyone, but I finally got a new corner desk for my room and I have been spending the past couple of days actually filling it with a lot of stuff so that I'm organized for once *SHOCK*.  So I was moving some notebooks around and a piece fell out of one.  I pick it up and find out it was one of the VERY few poems I ever wrote.  It was for a friend who was writing a story and couldn't come up with anything.  I thought I'd post it online and see what you peeps think of it.  Mind you there is a reason that I have only written a few poems.

<lj-cut>So without further ado, my rather poor poem, Spell.


With this spell
We dub to thee
Beyond the grave
For all to see

Though the storm
And lightning strike
We see the people come to hike
Upon the ground that is too still

Beyond the grave
The time has come
Let us see the great beyond

The truth be dear
Throughout the night
The one who comes is filled with fright
Upon all hallow's night

See I told you it was poor.  Strangely though its the only one to survive since my high school days.  Maybe one day I might resurrect it and use it in one of my fics.</lj-cut>

Just thought I'd catch everyone up on the events of my life.  Its been busy, but sadly with bare bones inspiration.  I have been working on an original in collaboration with a friend, but there really isn't much to post.  Same goes with Red Lined chapter 2.  Its putzing off the starting line....

Last weekend on July 10th, My family, my boyfriend, my next door neighbors daughter, and I went to the opening day of the Bristol Renaissance Faire.  It was great.  Dave and I were dressed as nobility, my parents were merchants(I married up in life apparently).  We rented a cute little princess dress for our next door neighbor, whom I was babysitting.  Pictures are up on the family website if anyone is interested.  Link will be given at the end of the entry.

We were able to see Moonie, a show where the performer doesn't say a word.  Man I love to watch him! Dave and I were asked to pose for a few pictures which I thought was surprising.  There were more people with better costumes than us.  The Jousting was fun since we sat on the evil knight's side and we were by far the loudest bunch.  Its great to be evil sometimes.  Of course we partied like it was 1599 ;-) as we ate and drank around the park.

So that was my weekend.

Today I went to the Kane County Fairground and watched a truck pull, which was a lot more fun than I first imagined it to be. We walked through a few 4H booths to see some of the kid projects.  The woodworking was remarkable.  Pics on the website later this week.

So far that has been my week.  Busy, uinspired, and very tired.  Maybe I'll get to relax this weekend.  Probably not.

My family website is http://millfam.org/cms

Enjoy!

My mom brought this home from work and after laughing I thought I would post it hear for others to get a good laugh.  So without further adieu I give you The 25 things my mother taught me.

1.  My mother taught me TO APPRECIATE A JOB WELL DONE.

      "If you're going to kill each other, do it outside.  I just finished cleaning."


2. My mother taught me RELIGION.

      "You better pray that will come out of the carpet."


3. My mother taught me about TIME TRAVEL.

       "If you don't straighten up, I'm going to knock you into the middle of next week."


4.My mother taught me LOGIC.

    "Because I said so, that's why."


5.  My mother taught me MORE LOGIC.

    "If you fall out of that swing and break your neck, you're not going to the store with me."


6.My mother taught me FORESIGHT.

     "Make sure you wear clean underwear, in case you're in an accident."


7.My mother taught me IRONY.

   "Keep crying, and I'll give you something to cry about."


8.  My mother taught me about the science of OSMOSIS.
   
      "Shut your mouth and eat your supper."


9.  My mother taught me about CONTORTIONISM.

     "Will you look at that dirt on the back of your neck!"


10.  My mother taught me about STAMINA.

     "You'll sit there until all that spinach is gone."


11.  My mother taught me about WEATHER.

      "This room of yours looks as if a tornado went through it."


12.  My mother me abou HYPOCRISY.

     "If I told you once, I've told you a million times.  Don't Exaggerate!"


13. My mother taught me the CIRCLE OF LIFE.

    "I brought you into this world, and I can take you out."


14.  My mother taught me about BEHAVIOR MODIFICATION.

     "Stop acting like your father!"


15.  My mother taught me about ENVY.

     "There are millions of less fortunate children in this world who don't have wonderful parents like you do."


16.  My mother taught me about ANTICIPATION.

     "Just wait until we get home."


17.  My mother taught me about RECEIVING.

    "You are going to get it when you get home!"


18.  My mother taught me MEDICAL SCIENCE.

     "If you don't stop crossing your eyes, they are going to freeze that way."


19.  My mother taught me ESP.

     "Put your sweater on; don't you think I know when you are cold?"


20.  My mother taught me HUMOR.

     "When that lawn mower cuts off your toes, don't come running to me."


21.  My mother taught me HOW TO BECOME AN ADULT.

     "If you don't eat your vegetables, you'll never grow up."


22.  My mother taught me GENETICS.

     "You're just like your father."


23.  My mother taught me about my ROOTS.

    "Shut that door behind you.  Do you think you were born in a barn?"


24.  My mother taught me WISDOM.

    "When you get to be my age, you'll understand."


25.  And my favorite-  

My mother taught me about JUSTICE.

     "One day you'll have kids, and I hope they turn out just like you!"

Let me just say this.


OMG!!!!!


Okay.  Now that I have that out of the way.


Yesterday here at lovely NIU we had MTV's Campus Invasion 2004.  That evening there was a concert at the Convocation Center which featured: Ima Robot, Lost Prophet, and Hoobastank.

Yes it was a great concert.

Anyway, my friend Juli asked me if I wanted to help out and I said sure.  So wednesday night I met the guy we would be working with and we sat there from nine at night to almost eleven at night.  So I go home finish up some stuff for classes and go to bed.  

I wake up at seven in the morning go to my eight to nine-fifteen class and the drive around for a half hour looking for a bloody parking spot.  Which ended up being like a half to three quarter mile away. Grrrrrrr.......  When I get there, finally, for the next two hours we unpacked the bags of free goodies, raiding them in the process :-D, and got them ready to hand out at noon.

At noon I have to leave to meet with my co-operating teacher since I am student teaching next semester.  I am very nervous about that and excited at the same time.  So I'm gone for about an hour and a half or so.  When I get back I'm put outside with instructions to trya nd get rid of two boxes so that there were only eight boxes for the night's concert.  Ooooookay.....

So what did I do?

"Free stuff!!! Get your free stuff!!!!  Takae as many as you would like!!!!  Give them to your friends and family!!!

Two boxes gone within a half hour and I send someone in for another box.  that one goes in fifteen minutes.  Its a little after three and we're packing up when the dude I'm working with comes out and asks how we did.  I told him we got rid of three boxes.  Three?  Yes, three.  I love you.  :-D

We pack up the last of the boxes to take to the Convo Center so we can unpack and prep for tonight.  Everything is unloaded at four and spend an hour going through the last three boxes for tonight.  We had a total of 1500 bags to hand out that evening.  ^^;  Yeah thats alot.  Well, there is a guy there who rubs elbows with the celebrities that come into town and whom Juli knows.  So while we're prepping bags she's begging him to let us meet Hoobastank.  And he leaves to actually try to get them to come out and meet us!

Before you start muttering curses and throwing fruit, we didn't meet them.  They had just finished working out and the bodyguard wouldn't let us in.  Shucks, we don't mind sweaty men in the shower.

At five o'clok we finish the bloody boxes and go home for two hours.  Concert prep time!!  Oh yeah, we got paid thirty bucks to hand out bags and go see the concert for free.  The volunteers got paid zilch and had to pay to go to the concert.  We got cool MTV Crew patches.  Juli is awesome with her awesome connection abilities.

At seven we mosey on in and start a hunt for the guy who said he would try to get us to meet Hoobastank.  No deal they were prepping for the concert and we couldn't get back there. Crud.  So we went in search of seats instead.  With our MTV passes we hadn't a clue where we could sit so we found some of the volunteers that worked the Invasion and we sat by them.  Which was gine, until one of the Ushers told us that we were in someone's seats so we got up and stood on the stairs wondering where we were supposed to go.  One of the backstage crew saw us standing there and motioned for us to come down and when we did we found out we got to sit in the backstage with the crew, guests, and any of the rockstars that stepped out.

WOOHOOO!!!!!!

So we sit down making the volunteer girls jealous since they had to pay for their tickets and we get in free and sit backstage.  BTW, Don't hate me.  So we sit down and the concert gets underway.  The first band IMA ROBOT, which let me say sucks ass live.  I swear the lead singer was on something.  The background musicand vocals were good, but to have any chance I say get rid of the lead singer.  It was just bad.  They finish their set and the stage is set up for the next band, LOST PROPHETS.

Lost Prophets was a pretty good band.  I really liked their music and I even bought their CD.  During their set me and another girl had to go to the bathroom and we couldn't go to the ones that were on the main floor so we had to go backstage to use their facilities.  And since we had never been back there we got lost...

Well, we were standing at an Y intersection deciding which way to go when we hear behind us a "Hey Girls!"  We turned and this guy walked up to us and we started chatting.  Then he realized where he had seen us before, "Hey aren't you the girls who were passing out the bags this morning?" "Yes." "Cool.  So where are you two headed?"

Okay, now me being out of the musical loop and not knowing who this was I answer, "We're looking for the bathroom."  The guy nodded and said he didn't know where it was, but we were welcome to come and hang out after the concert.  And then he walks into the Hoobastank room.

Great.... I just told a member of Hoobastank that we were looking for the bathroom.  It gets better...  My friend turned to me and said, "Do you know who that was?"  "A member of Hoobastank."  "That was Doug, the lead singer!"  "WHAT?" Now I feel even more embarassed.

So we head to the bathrooms and on our way back we find out that LOST PROPHET has finished and was heading to their room.  So we stood off on the side to let them through and one of the members, Jamie, the keyboardist stops by us and puts a sweaty arm around our shoulders.  "Hey girls, How about a drink?" And he has a welsh accent.  Me drooling on the floor over accents.  "Later, maybe.  We have to work the end of the concert." I say.  He nods and says, "Come back then.  Don't mind the sweat."  We never mind sweaty rockstars with their arms around us.  Never ever. Drool...

Heading back to our seats my friend says that our other friend is going to shit a brick because she didn't go with us to the bathroom.  We get back to our seats and she asks what took us so long.  My response, "You should have gone to the bathroom with us." "Why?"  "We just met the lead singer of hoobastank and the keyboardist of Lost Prophet." "You bitches!!!"

Hey, you snooze you lose.

Anyway out of the blue she says "why don't you show mw where the bathroom is in case I need to use it."

Riiiiiight....  Just want to know where it is....

So we all troop backstage again and Jamie pops out of Lost prophet and comes to talk to us again.  "Girls, you're back.  Here for drinks now?"
"No, we're just showing someone where something is."  "And what's that?"
My friend answers this time.  "We're showing Katie where the bathroom is."  It wasn't me this time!  Meanwhile, Katie, "Uhuh......."

Anyway that was pretty much the evening.  we all had a blast and no we didn't party with the bands afterwards.  I'm still kicking myself on that one.  Damn jealous boyfriends that show up where they aren't wanted.  And worse when its the boyfriend of your ride.  The three of us got screwed royally in my opinion.

On another note, this entry was began on April 23, 2004 and now it is April 26, 2004.  Stupid projects and places to go and phone calls.  I hope you enjoyed the narrative of my evening.  Please keep the rotten fruit throwing to a minimum.

Gah!

I really hate the end of the semester.  there is so much to do and definitely not enough time to get it all in it seems.

Procrastinator?  Me?  Nah.....

To top all that off my muse seems to be on a constant bouncing off the ceiling and walls sugar high.  The damn thing wakes me up in the middle of the night, drags me to my computer, and has me type scenes of fics until I can't see straight!  Not to mention that with new sugar high muse I have more story ideas and fics started then I can count on both hands!

When will the insanity end I ask myself...frequently.

The answer...I haven't a friggin clue.

I do have some sort of an idea, but its not what I originally wanted.  I was going to submit three original short stories to a writing contest, but that's being tossed out the window until next year.  I do have one short story finished and all I'm waiting on is for my friend and editor to finish looking it over.  Yes, Saro this means you.  :-)  No worries though, not mad about it at all.  If you don't get the chance then I'll submit it as is.

Anyways, my idea.  This summer between summer classes, and weddings I want to work on and finish my two GW ideas and my FMA idea which may or may not go through.  Its still in the planning stage.  During fall which is my student teaching semester I will be working with my sister and best friend on a large scale novel project.  Joy... Right?  I hope to get something done on it.  

Anyway, the other fanfics are on hiatus until further notice.  I have more of Rebirth of a Demon finished, just waiting for my editor on the fixes I need to do before that will come out.  For any and all who are curious, Dreamscapes is slowly progressing.  Just waiting for my muse to calm down enough to look at it again.

On the other hand all my other original fic ideas are also on vacation.  If I can at least get those two to three ideas done this summer I hope to resuscitate Dreamscapes and get it moving.  Yes, Dreamscapes and Rebirth are Inuyasha fics.  I also have in the works a labyrinth idea and an escaflowne.  All on the back burner for now.

I should be concentrating on school, but writing is so much more fun.  As I work on my fics I'll post ideas or even a chapter for everyone to read.  Let me know what you think!

Bye everyone.
As I said before Full Metal Alchemist is kick ass and I am so absolutely infatuated with it.

Well, its been almost a year and its been pretty darn busy.  I'm close to finishing school and a lot of things have been inadvertently been put on hold.  I barely have time to write anymore either which really sucks, but what can I do.  School comes first.

Life has been in general good. I passed my two year anniversary and we're going strong.  I signed up for summer classes and that is going to be fun.  I'm taking Driver's Education Courses so that by the end of the summer I will be certified to teach people how to drive.  SCary thought isn't it.

This fall I will be student teaching and then I graduate in December.  I've got my fingers crossed that I do a good job.  Wish me luck.

With the new year I am trying to get back onto my writing and I have been working on a couple of GW fics along with some original ideas that pop into my head.  AS of right now, thats my life.

LONG LIVE FULL METAL ALCHEMIST!  THE BEST NEW ANIME OUT THIS YEAR!

Well, its almost been a month since I wrote anything on here.  In that time that I have not written anything, A lot has been going on.  I nearly broke up with my boyfriend.  The people I told you about are under investigation for child neglect.  I have a huge roach infestation problem thta just won't go away.  My friends grandmother died while he was visiting meand now its the last week of summer classes.  I'm tired and sore and tired.  I'm also in the process of whipping up a website and working on my fiction.  There isn't much going on in my life, but what I do have is plenty.

I may not be a parent, but some things really piss me off about people who have kids.  A friend of mine and I won't name names has a son and she is really getting to the point where I am concerned wheter or not she needs to be reported.  Her little boy I recently found out has had a hernia in his belly button for the past 18 months and she was supposed to take him in for surgery to get it removed.  Hasn't been done yet.

And another thing this girl treats her friends like crap.  She went to walmart with another girl,Jan and offered to watch her kids along with her son.  When Jan gets back, the son is in the driver seat with the car on and pushing buttons all over the place.  When they start driving off the car won't go over 40mph.  when Jan finally asks about the parking break she finally nonchalantly tells her that her son had it on.  By now the parking break is gone.  thats at least a $300 dollar repair that she won't pay for.

It gets worse.  She hasn't washed her son in a while.  how long I don't know, but now the poor boy has crotch rot or something like that.  I can't believ she calls herself a parent.  The final straw that leads to this entry is when she was at another friends, Dana, she made a sandwich without asking Dana.  Then her son makes the motions of wanting food since he can't talk yet and she flat out tells him if he wants to eat he will do it himself or not at all.  When I heard that I wanted to go rip her a new one and take her boy away.  i don't wnat a child growing up in an enviornment like that.  Its not right.

This woman should seriuosly not have kids.  She doesn't clean her own house with the reasoning of taking care of a kid is a full time job.  She can't do twenty million things.  What about those single parents who seem to get everything done?

I'm sorry for this long rant, but I'm so mad that this boy is growing up in an enviornment where he's basically being taught that he's a worthless human being.  Its not right.  And its going to stop.  A few "friends" are calling her in.  She shouldn't be having a child if she can't even care for him properly.

Well, here goes.  The first entry and the question comes to mind.  What the devil do I talk about?  Well, I'm a big writer in both original and fan fiction.  Nothing up currently, but that should change in a few weeks.  I have one short story almost finished and is getting sent out to be betaed this weekend.  The other piece of fiction that I have been working on is an AU off the Inuyasha series.  That one be seeing the light of day for a long time...

On another note, I have to get to bed soon.  I take summer classes and tomorrow, err.. today is a long day.
